alert.note: Alert for Bath; Estill; Fleming; Menifee; Montgomery; Powell; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 4:27PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Powell, Montgomery, Bath, northern Estill, western Menifee, southeastern Fleming and western Rowan Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 426 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong showers and a few thunderstorms along a line extending from Flat Creek to Westbend to near Blackburn. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Owingsville, Clay City, Levee, Reynoldsville, Flat Creek, Kendall Springs, Stepstone, Stoops, Prewitt and Klondike around 430 PM EDT. Camargo, Slate Valley, Odessa, Bean, Craigs, Peasticks, Coons Station, Bourbon Furnace, Gatewoods Station and Harris Ferry around 435 PM EDT. Marshall, Jeffersonville, Wyoming, Hope, Walkers Crossing, Clay Lick, Oggs Station, Lucky Stop, Hargett and Oakley around 440 PM EDT. Hardwick, Cottage Furnace, Grange City, Ringos Mills, Vaughns Mill, Crooks, Hillsboro, Preston, Spout Springs and Cornwell around 445 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Stanton, Frenchburg, Olympia Springs, Knowlton, Sharkey, Furnace, Sudith, Olympia, Hilda, Plummers Landing, Salt Lick, Young Springs, Rosslyn, Cat Creek, Bowen, Rogers Chapel, Muses Mills, Polksville, Ratlitt, Campsites in the Indian Creek area of the Daniel Boone National Forrest, Waltz, Lombard, Nada, Farmers, Haystack, Midland, Freestone, Bluestone and Slade. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bath; Estill; Fleming; Menifee; Montgomery; Powell; Rowan
